snippet: Airlines are struggling to get flight crews and support personnel back in place for travelers who were unlucky enough to be heading home during Hurricane Sandy.
abstract: Airline system in Northeast begins slow reboot following Hurricane Sandy, but many passengers unlucky enough to be caught in region remain stranded; effort is hobbled by  lack of flight crews and personnel, as many employees are still unable to travel to work.

byline.original: By ROBBIE BROWN and CHRISTOPHER DREW
byline.contributor: Robbie Brown reported from Atlanta and Christopher Drew from Newark.

lead_paragraph: Airlines are struggling to get flight crews and support personnel back in place for travelers who were unlucky enough to be heading home during Hurricane Sandy.

headline.seo: After Hurricane Sandy, Returning to the Air
headline.print_headline: Beginning a Laborious Comeback: Airlines Gradually Restart a Storm-Stricken System
